abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan would make available
            US$114.9 million to help meet foreign exchange requirements
            for high priority imports in support of an Economic Recovery
            Program (ERP) agreed upon with the Government. The loan
            would also finance US$100,000 in technical assistance. The
            counterpart funds generated would help finance priority
            investment projects except that, if warranted by demand, up
            to US$15 million in counterpart funds may be used to
            establish a dollar denominated revolving fund to finance
            imports used in the production of non-traditional exports.
            The main risk that the program loan faces is whether
            political developments in Peru might impede the
            Government's efforts to carry out the stringent ERP.
